definition[0]: the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
definition[1]: relating to the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
definition[2]: affecting almost everything or everyone, and often done without any concern for the results
example[1]: the capture and wholesale destruction of a city
example[2]: This company will not be successful until there are wholesale changes.
definition[3]: the business of selling large quantities of goods at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
definition[4]: involving the business of selling goods in large quantities to businesses, rather than to the general public
example[4]: Japan’s overallwholesale prices in December were unchanged.
definition[5]: involving the business of providing services to other businesses, rather than to the general public
example[5]: The country’s long-term credit banks are primarily wholesale lenders (=banks that lend to other financial institutions and to companies).
